text: The Dems have to find their ‘A’ game soon. If they have one.

text: At this point, it’s up to our fourth estate, journalism, to foil this conspiracy of silence and make this vital information available to the people of the United States. It’s the last institution that can cleanse our republic and preserve our Constitution.
author: BobLewisOfRVA

text: Good. I’d hate to say an 2-seed from the SEC lost to a tube of toothpaste.

text: #wahoowa! If my Rebs are out, I’m behind the flagship of my adopted state! Love the way Tony Bennett has his guys playing.
author: BobLewisOfRVA

text: Shaq can pretty much take whatever he damn well pleases.
author: BobLewisOfRVA

text: Twitter ain’t the smartest forum for her to plead her case, either.

text: Love y’all back. Always will. Can’t wait for next season. Y’all started something.

text: It’s the NCAA Tournament, man! Thank God we have it as an alternative! #Wahoowa

text: Well turned, sir.
author: BobLewisOfRVA

text: Looking on the bright side, at least now I don't have to dread watching what @UVAMensHoops would have done to @OleMissMBB on Sunday and the hell I'd have taken from my UVA friends all week. Congrats to the Wahoos! (And thanks for keeping my bracket viable!) #Wahoowa
author: BobLewisOfRVA

text: OK, I think it's safe to take @jtuckermartin off suicide watch. With five minutes left, UVA leads Gardner-Webb by 14 and is pulling away.
author: BobLewisOfRVA

text: Looks like UVA's found its gear now. Not out of the woods by any means, but not trailing.
author: BobLewisOfRVA

text: SEC not making a stellar accounting of itself today after Kentucky showed out last night. Tennessee and Colgate tied at 52 each in the second half. @OleMissMBB rolling over vs. Oklahoma sucked, but could the Vols really lose to a tube of toothpaste?
author: BobLewisOfRVA

text: PLEASE, @UVAMensHoops, pull this one out over Gardner-Webb. My bracket NEEDS you. I need you. I have to have SOMETHING to believe in ...
author: BobLewisOfRVA

text:
A 23-point beatdown by Oklahoma in the opening round. Two (supposedly) evenly matched teams. We gave up 95 POINTS???? Would not have imagined Duke could put up that many against this team. But ... 

This team did a lot of good things this year. Today surely was not one of them.
author: BobLewisOfRVA

text: Somewhat in disbelief seeing @OleMissMBB collapse like cheap folding chair vs. Oklahoma. No words. Whatever prepared is, this team was the opposite of it when it showed up in Columbia.
author: BobLewisOfRVA

text: Aaand Oklahoma just extended the lead to 20 points. This is ghastly. I never dreamed this team would roll over and die like this.
author: BobLewisOfRVA

text: You can almost see him scream at Trump, "You can't HANDLE the truth!" And that statement would be true on many levels.
author: BobLewisOfRVA

text: Don't look now (seriously, DON'T!), @OleMissMBB fans, but our Rebs are hardly acquitting themselves the way any of us had hoped. Down by 17 with 7 minutes still left til halftime.
author: BobLewisOfRVA

text: Crap like this is why people find it ever more easy to discount “science.” Weak research and even worse journalism about what the results do and don’t mean. Who funds silly whimsy like this anyway? Surely there are better uses for that money.
author: BobLewisOfRVA

text: When March Madness Goes Wrong: 5 Cautionary Tales
author: BobLewisOfRVA

text: That’s why it’s called the NIT —Nobody’s Interested Tournament. If you aren’t among the 68 teams who are invited to the only tournament that means anything, this is one big walk of shame.
author: BobLewisOfRVA

text: Or one better: consider kids their age who had to contend with the Great Depression at home when Pearl Harbor forced them to contemplate things like Omaha Beach, Iwo Jima and Midway overseas. #GreatestGeneration

text: 10 for Ole Miss fans. Probably a 3 for UVA fans. I think UMBC imprinted an indelible lesson on the Hoos about taking the night off vs. a lower-seeded team. That won’t happen this year. But Ole Miss would give ‘em all they can handle. #HottyToddy
author: BobLewisOfRVA

text: That's it! (May Justin Reed rest in peace.)
author: BobLewisOfRVA

text: Makes us long for a more decent time not that long ago.
author: BobLewisOfRVA

text: Maybe. Not sure my memory is that good. I do remember that we made it into the Sweet Sixteen in the late 1990s or early 2000s when Rob Evans was coach. That was the year we were eliminated by Valparaiso's uncontested walkoff 3-pointer at the buzzer.
author: BobLewisOfRVA

text: Buuut, enough about Dan Mullen ...
author: BobLewisOfRVA

text: Here on the eve of the real start of @marchmadness, I make my guaranteed, ironclad prediction: the team that wins its next six games will be the 2019 national champion. That's my story and I'm sticking to it. #HottyToddy
author: BobLewisOfRVA

text: Actually, Hillary was wrong: deplorable doesn’t begin to cover it.

text: We gotta make it past Oklahoma first. I’m hoping @OleMissMBB will break it’s one-and-done habit in postseason hoops. And, as UVA learned a year ago from UMBC, not even a No. 1 seed can sleep on a 16 seed in the opener. Hotty Toddy!

text: This guy has no soul, no conscience, not a scintilla of moral integrity or decency. Remember the years when President Reagan led a party that came to power through addition, not division?

text: They wrote off a cliche slur against people of Irish descent as acceptable collateral damage in the pursuit of a cheap shot on O’Rourke, whom they have ample reason to fear.

text: They only ridicule that which they fear.

text: We’re going to see who really runs this network.

author: BobLewisOfRVA

text: Why would anyone (much less a president) not call out violent white supremacists? Isn’t that something that all decent humans can agree upon? Shouldn’t that be as simple and automatic as denouncing disease, famine and war? Silence here screams bloody murder!
author: BobLewisOfRVA

text: So he’s a geography major!
author: BobLewisOfRVA

text: There is a difference between being an “entertainer,” as Limbaugh insists he is when called out for his destructive buffoonery, and an intentional propagandist for the world’s most malignant movements.
author: BobLewisOfRVA

text: Bullies, because they are cowards by definition, always attack those they believe won’t fight back, but only the most craven and indecent among them will actually prey upon the dead.

text: Even the 2015 Sugar Bowl title team underperformed considering the talent that was on the roster.

text: Yes it does, Kerry. Great example. It’s disheartening to look at the number of Rebels who have been high NFL draft picks and those who’ve turned in astounding results at this year’s Combine and then consider how little we’ve had to show for it.
author: BobLewisOfRVA

text: Hard to say which is the greater threat to the globe over the next decade: xenophobic nationalism or unchecked climate change. Both have the capacity to be cataclysmic.
author: BobLewisOfRVA

text: Yeah, but maybe he wants more “West Wing” reruns? He can’t get enough of Leo McGarry?
author: BobLewisOfRVA

text: It’s a mental thing. Like flaming out at home in the baseball regionals. There’s some sort of confidence issue or mental block. The only thing keeping these kids from being champions is they don’t know how to finish and secure the win. Damned frustrating.
author: BobLewisOfRVA

text: At some point, Ole Miss teams -- all sports -- have to gain the confidence to finish, to get tough in the late going and win when it matters. This is a drumbeat. We can upset teams when the pressure's not on, but when it's crunch time, we can't put opponents away.
author: BobLewisOfRVA
